meanings.definition: A company that operates a fleet of trucks for transporting goods.
meanings.sent1: The truckline delivered the packages on time.
meanings.sent2: The truckline expanded its services to reach more customers.
meanings.sent3: The truckline drivers had a race to see who could deliver first!
meanings.sent4: The truckline was a long chain of vehicles snaking through the highway.
meanings.sent5: The truckline logo was proudly displayed on each vehicle.

meanings.definition: The business of transporting goods by truck.
meanings.sent1: She invested in a truckline to start her own business.
meanings.sent2: The truckline industry plays a crucial role in the economy.
meanings.sent3: The truckline business boomed after offering express delivery.
meanings.sent4: The truckline of commerce kept the city supplied with essentials.
meanings.sent5: The truckline operations ran smoothly with efficient logistics.

meanings.definition: A line of trucks used for transportation.
meanings.sent1: The truckline stretched for miles along the highway.
meanings.sent2: The truckline of vehicles moved slowly through the traffic.
meanings.sent3: The truckline at the border caused a delay in crossing.
meanings.sent4: The truckline resembled a colorful parade of moving boxes.
meanings.sent5: The truckline of delivery trucks was an impressive sight to behold.
